notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform release 4.4.8 is now available with
updates to packages and images that fix several bugs.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing
Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private
cloud deployments.

This advisory contains the RPM packages for Red Hat OpenShift Container
Platform 4.4.8. See the following advisory for the container images for
this release:

https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2020:2445

All OpenShift Container Platform 4.4 users are advised to upgrade to these updated packages and images when they are available in the appropriate release channel. To check for available updates, use the OpenShift Console or the CLI oc command. Instructions for upgrading a cluster are available at https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.4/updating/updating-cluster-between-minor.html#understanding-upgrade-channels_updating-cluster-between-minor.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

document.title: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: OpenShift Container Platform 4.4.8 packages update

notes.text: Jenkins 2.227 and earlier, LTS 2.204.5 and earlier uses different representations of request URL paths, which allows attackers to craft URLs that allow bypassing CSRF protection of any target URL.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CSRF protection bypass via crafted URLs
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For OpenShift Container Platform 4.4 see the following documentation, which
will be updated shortly for release 4.4.8, for important instructions on
how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this asynchronous errata
update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.4/release_notes/ocp-4-4-release-notes.html

Details on how to access this content are available at
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.4/updating/updating-cluster-cli.html.

vulnerabilities.title: CSRF protection bypass via crafted URLs

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: Jenkins 2.227 and earlier, LTS 2.204.5 and earlier does not properly escape node labels that are shown in the form validation for label expressions on job configuration pages, resulting in a stored XSS vulnerability exploitable by users able to define node labels.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: Jenkins 2.227 and earlier, LTS 2.204.5 and earlier does not set Content-Security-Policy headers for files uploaded as file parameters to a build, resulting in a stored XSS vulnerability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Content-Security-Policy headers for files uploaded leads to XSS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: Jenkins 2.227 and earlier, LTS 2.204.5 and earlier improperly processes HTML content of list view column headers, resulting in a stored XSS vulnerability exploitable by users able to control column headers.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: improperly processes HTML content of list leads to XSS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
